feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: The daily wage calculator is a payroll system component that automatically computes and deducts daily pay for employees taking unpaid leave. It determines the appropriate salary reduction by dividing an employee's total salary (basic salary plus allowances) by the number of actual working days in the month. The feature supports two leave policy models: calendar days (e.g., 30 days) and working days (e.g., 22 days). Public holidays falling within the calculation month are automatically deducted from the working days count to arrive at the actual working days figure. When an unpaid leave request is approved, the system automatically generates a corresponding pay deduction that is reflected on the payroll table. The feature ensures consistent and accurate salary calculations across the organization by applying standardized daily pay formulas. It integrates with leave management and employee record systems to process deductions seamlessly. The calculator eliminates manual computation errors and ensures compliance with the organization's leave and payroll policies. The daily wage calculator (DWC) is a payroll feature that enables Super admins to adjust and calculate an employee's salary proportionally based on the actual days worked. This feature affects critical payroll calculations including an employee's first salary and end-of-service settlement amounts. The daily wage calculator supports multiple calculation bases—custom days, calendar days, or working days—allowing organizations to align salary proration with their specific operational requirements. When Super admins update salary proration settings through the Daily Wage Calculation interface, the changes are applied to all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table, ensuring consistency across payroll records. The feature is designed to ensure accurate compensation when employees have incomplete work periods, such as during onboarding or separation. By providing flexible calculation methodologies, the daily wage calculator accommodates diverse payroll policies and regulatory requirements across different organizational contexts.

source_articles_index.title: How is daily pay calculated
source_articles_index.article_summary: This article explains how daily pay is calculated for unpaid leave deductions. It describes the formula (Daily Pay = Salary Amount / Actual Working Days), clarifies the two leave policy types (calendar days and working days), and details how public holidays are deducted from working days. It includes a worked example demonstrating the calculation when public holidays fall within the month.

source_articles_index.title: Salary Proration
source_articles_index.article_summary: This article explains how to update salary proration in the Daily Wage Calculator (DWC). Super admins can change how salary is prorated by selecting calculation bases (custom days, calendar days, or working days) through Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation. Salary proration affects an employee's first salary and end-of-service settlement. Changes apply to all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table. When payroll month is open with submitted prorated salary transactions, Super admin must reject existing transactions before saving new proration settings.
